newsitem.title: FRANCE: Paris Bourse slumps after Wall Street slide.
newsitem.headline: Paris Bourse slumps after Wall Street slide.

text.p: French shares opened sharply lower on Tuesday after two days of deep losses on Wall Street, with the CAC-40 blue-chip index starting 2.69 percent lower.
At 0808 GMT, the index was down 75.49 points, or 2.84 percent, lower at 2,581.19 while the April futures contract was 77.50 points lower at 2,580.50.
The French market was closed on Friday and Monday for Easter holidays when the Dow Jones index lost 297 points in two sessions.
Brokers said they were seeing support at 2,575, 2,570 and 2,563 points before very strong support at 2,550.
"It's a very agitated market. All my phones are ringing constantly," a broker said.
"We are not too worried," said another. "We had a range of 2,500 to 2,700 for the market and we are still in that range, be it nearer to the bottom" he added.

Shares in glassmaker Saint-Gobain were down 2.23 percent at 833 francs. Chairman Jean-Louis Beffa said he expected a 1997 increase in net income of at least 20 percent after a four percent increase in 1996 net attributable profit to 520 million francs.
